ygData.subject: IGL Update
ygData.msgSnippet: (Okay, the IGL will most definately be postponed.  Very, very, very sorry. There are some major reasons.  Number one, I was going to schedule the first matches

Subject: IGL Update
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: CompuServe 2000 32-bit sub 107
From: KSLawdogg@...

(Okay, the IGL will most definately be postponed.  Very, very, very sorry.  
There are some major reasons.  Number one, I was going to schedule the first 
matches this Monday, but thanks to my brother messing with my computer, I 
can't access my archive of e-mails and that kind of had my whole game plan on 
it.  See, I passworded it, but it's not recognizing my password.  So...I'm 
not happy.  Also Rdahl has hounded me down since he wants to enter the IGL 
and told me to freeze it J/K

It's very late, 1 AM Pacific, my brother being lazy, he'll attempt to fix my 
computer completely.  But even if he does, I still have to reinstall 
Realplayer, RealJukeBox, all my games, and a ton of stuff. Moving files, 
yadda yadda.  So I need to take a little mental break.  I'll still 
participate OOC and IC and work on the IGL thing.  I pretty much have it all 
figured out, I just need that list that is password protected...and I need to 
speak with Yan when he gets back from gambling away all his money...errr, I 
mean "Defcon", about him watching the IGL for any moding.  I noticed some 
strong characters in a few bios and a few powers concern me ::Is looking at 
Rdahl :):: J/K

So, thanks for all you IGL contestants, I'm very sorry about postponing it, I 
don't want to.  I want to start it.  It's off schedule by two weeks and that 
ain't good.  But, but, so some things can get rolling ya know, if you want a 
character to be in a fight to the death match, e-mail me personally with the 
name of that character(s) who will fight to the death.  Then I will pair them 
up with anyone else who wants to do so.  )

Thanks very much -
L. Unitron
